title: [Compilation] how to disable caffe2?
body_html:
Hi
I have to compile and build pytorch from the source due to my geforce 920mx card.
Now with merging caffe2 into pytorch the compilation time gets multipled beside the error i get when i try building it with gcc-6 (i also get error near the end of building for gcc-5: gcc-5: error: unrecognized command line option ‘-fno-plt’).
So is there any flag or switch to not include and compile caffe2 with pytorch?
Thanks.
body_text:
Hi
I have to compile and build pytorch from the source due to my geforce 920mx card.
Now with merging caffe2 into pytorch the compilation time gets multipled beside the error i get when i try building it with gcc-6 (i also get error near the end of building for gcc-5: gcc-5: error: unrecognized command line option ‘-fno-plt’).
So is there any flag or switch to not include and compile caffe2 with pytorch?
Thanks.
body:
Hi
I have to compile and build pytorch from the source due to my geforce 920mx card. 
Now with merging caffe2 into pytorch the compilation time gets multipled beside the error i get when i try building it with `gcc-6` (i also get error near the end of building for gcc-5: `gcc-5: error: unrecognized command line option ‘-fno-plt’`).
So is there any flag or switch to **not** include and compile caffe2 with pytorch?
Thanks.
